channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024021809
item.description:
Report X-2024021809

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jerrican shipped without overpack. Jerrican punctured and spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called upon an Admin for assistance in containing the leakage. DescribePack: The leakage stems from a loose lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to unload and pail was on ground with the outer label wet, QA placed pail inside an lined tote and took to hazmat cage. DescribePack: The closure came loose and liquid leaked out which made outer label to soil. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: Pail was placed inside an lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report X-2024021810
item.description:
Report X-2024021810

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in sealed plastic bags inside corrugated carton with corrugated top spacer. Loose, cross-threaded caps on two jugs allowed spillage that soiled jugs and damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

DescribePack: Upon inspection all the inner closures had loose closures and a small amount of liquid leaked out of every bottle and the outer carton got a little soiled. DurationRel: 44 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was taken to hazmat cage and I inspected.

DescribePack: Plastic jugs with taped caps in zip-tied plastic bags inside doublewall corrugated carton with bubble wrap filler. Loose caps on three jugs allowed leakage which soiled jugs and damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to unload trailer 950021 due to a leaking hazmat, QA arrived and pkg was wet on the outer carton so QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Closures came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottes, this was a unprocessed hazmat as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage to get inspected.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic pail in corrugated carton with no filler or padding. Carton torn along one edge. Pail cracked 2/3 of length down one side, spilling powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024021499
item.description:
Report X-2024021499

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The inner plastic container/bag is very thin and was punctured allowing the acetone to slowly leak from the inner packaging and absorb into the outer packaging until it was soggy and noticeable. It was then placed in a lined hazmat tote and brought to the designated damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: The inner plastic container is too thin and is easily punctured. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Just placed in a lined hazmat tote to contain the leaked liquid.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being unloaded when it was noticed that the bottom of the box was slightly soggy. It was then place in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the designated damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: The bottles of liquid have loose caps that are allowing liquid to slowly leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright which stopped any further leaking.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. came the Hub QA chute and I noticed outer carton was wet and notified Sort Manager immediately, stating that unloaders are placing hazmats in sorter and gave him trailer # that it was unloaded from he got with manager to make sure manager has in their presort meetings about hazmats going into sorter, DescribePack: All closures had come loose and 3 bottles leaked out a small amount of liquid but 1 bottle leaked out more than the others in shipment DurationRel: 14 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report E-2024020516
item.description:
Report E-2024020516

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN3093 Ferric Nitrate Solution 41% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to the top of the poly tote and tote body due to a loose and crooked cap. The contractors re-secured the cap back onto the tote and wiped down the poly tote for shipment on. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report X-2024021343
item.description:
Report X-2024021343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an Admin's assistance in containing the shipment. DescribePack: The metal pail is badly dented, and there appears to be a small puncture mark within the denting. The leaked contents came from that puncture mark. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.
